question: 延ばす
sourceAnswer: to{} grow-long-(e.g.-hair,-nails) | lengthen/extend/stretch | reach-out/hold-out | straighten/smooth-out | spread-evenly-(dough,-cream,-etc.) | dilute/thin-out | postpone | prolong | strengthen/develop/expand
activeAnswer: to{} grow-long-(e.g.-hair,-nails) | lengthen/extend/stretch | reach-out/hold-out | straighten/smooth-out | spread-evenly-(dough,-cream,-etc.) | dilute/thin-out | postpone | prolong | strengthen/develop/expand
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>prolong</kanji> and this verb means <vocabulary>to prolong something</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: 

Do you mind if I go <vocabulary>to prolong</vocabulary> things? The answer? "<reading>No</reading> (<ja>の</ja>), I don't mind."
